question.body: Hemoglobin is made of globin proteins, a planar heme molecule and an iron ion. Which is the correct order of size from largest to smallest?

response.feedback: Correct. Globin surrounds and protects the heme molecule, which consists of a central iron ion.
Incorrect. Globin is relatively large, consisting of eight alpha-helical segments.
Incorrect. Iron is an ion contained within heme, and is therefore the smallest in size.
Incorrect. Globin is relatively large, consisting of eight alpha-helical segments. It surrounds the planar heme molecule.

part.hint: Refer to the structure of hemoglobin.
